intro: Turraea mombassana subsp. mombassana, commonly known as Mombassa turraea, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas.
